text: this sounds like it could've been part of the first shantae game
author: Galladite 614

text: I'd love to hear this played by a band.
author: Ostra Diemgi

text: Aaah infogrames... Wouldn't expect any less. Always excellent music.
author: WH250398

text: Don't thanks Infogrames but Alberto José Gonzalez and Bit Managers who developped the game. Infogrames was only the editor for the GB versions :)
author: Matt Productions

text: After listening to your tracks I thought this would be from Asterix heh!
author: Vaseem Baig

text: The particular thing with this song is that Alberto didn't compose it exactly alone, he based it on a song from the Snes version. Still both version are very different to the point of not being the same song, and I prefer this one, though the snes equivalent hag got some interesting parts too.
author: pierre aubry

text: This game's OST was outrageously good
author: StevenTravelCaptainRogers

text: Unbelievably great song, and its not the only one from this game.  That Gonzalez guy sure is nice surprise.
author: Stewie G

text: Dude you have one of the best channels on YouTube, you have helped me through so many boring days of work, and through so much of my depression. The collection of music you have is golden.
author: D9

text: This song is fun to whistle.
author: Francis Robert

text: This is ridiculously catchy.
author: awesomealli

text: This is badass.
author: Dongle Daggles

text: I feel insane that this is picked, I just learned this game existed a few weeks ago
author: StingX2

text: curious, why the french game cover
author: StopFlaggingVideos

text: StopFlaggingVideos maybe because tintin speack french ?...
author: maxime koryciak

text: Gonzalez and his supra catchy tunes. Did you know the "Supra" in my name comes from me saying "supra" instead of "super" when I was a kid? Yeah, you must be disappointed.
author: SupraDarky

text: Wow. This whole time I thought you were a fan/owner of the Toyota Supra.
author: HeySweden!

text: ultra+super= supra.
author: Sam Brown

text: @BeleuchteteBrueder THAT'S RA.....
author: David Harris

text: "Comment referring to the new youtube comment system"

text: Pretty much the same beat as the mountain(?) theme from one of the Smurf-games that you uploaded before
author: JFK piano

text: Yes, cause it's from the same composer. He has a very distinct, easily recognizeable style
author: Gregor geht nach Japan

text: I'm not sure if it's just me, but i really don't like the new comments system for Youtube.  It doesn't make much sense to me.
author: Eric C.

text: Reminds me of Monkey Island. Never played this game, but it sure has a great soundtrack.
author: SkeletonBill

text: Well, TIL. And damn, this beat is catchy.
author: lacoot

text: Hmm, it seems like people can reply to user comments except mine? Must be some temporary problem. Edit: Scratch that, you can reply to this one.. weird. Wait, I can edit now? And is there even a character limit anymore? So many changes! Edit 2: It's fixed now, I guess.
author: SupraDarky

text: #yoloswag
author: Bilbo Mc.Bobbity Boop

text: No character limit and editing is nice, but did I really just have to scroll through the whole page to see your comment? Shouldn't yours be at the top?
author: Ben Briskorn

text: I really like Gonzalez's soundtracks as they were quite good and he is one of my more favorite composers on limited hardware.  It's a shame that some of the games that he composed weren't all that good.
author: Eric C.

text: Supraman. :D
author: misfire33

text: You're right, it is pretty catchy. Hmm seems youtube changed again. Can't reply to comments, thumbs up or down either.
author: Everlasting

text:
@*****
Replies only seem to work for maybe half of all comments I can see. The same seems to be the case for up and down votes as well as threaded comments.
On some videos there are no threaded comments (and even the hyperlinks to the responded-to comment don't work), yet on others there are. I'm still not sure what determines whether I can vote on and respond to comments, though...
author: MishtahPoog

text: Yeah, this is quite the change. We'll get used to it I'm sure, but for now, its a headache.
author: Everlasting
